artist: Artist: Utagawa Hiroshige II; Publisher: Tsutaya Kichizō
catalogue_raissonne: Ukiyo-e shūka 14 (1981), Hiroshige list, p. 250, ōban #58 ?
creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
inscription: Two middle columns: listing 36 titles of \"View of Mt. Fuji\" series; Bottom column quote (written by Santei Shunba): (I heard Hiroshige the First often say that he was going to give up painting and shake off the dust of the world rather than see his brush lose its power as age crept on him. One day Hiroshige came to the publisher with 36 Views of Mt. Fuji, which he said were his last work, and asked him to engrave them. It was beginning of the last Autumn, and at the close of the Autumn he died, aged 62. I think it was as the proverb says \"An insect must have told him\", and therefore the publisher whose behalf I write this, has carefully printed them in respectful comemoration of the artist.)
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Thirty-six Views of Mount Fuji (Fuji sanjūrokkei 冨士三十六景)
title: Frontispiece to Thirty-six Views of Mt.Fuji
